results.title: Seven more stations
results.creator_credit: Victor Sheridan, Patrick Henry and Academy Picture Corporation

results.title: Semi-conductors. Part I. Diodes and triodes
results.brief_description: The basic physics and theory of hole and electron flow in semi-conductor material as related to the P.N. junction. Basic transistor or triode operating characteristics show how and why it is an amplifying device.

results.title: Selling America
results.creator_credit: General Motors and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of Benjamin Franklin’s principle of human association as applied to modern salesmanship. The following rules for successful selling are suggested: Get the prospect talking; don’t argue but be pleasant and helpful; agree with the customer, answering “yes…, but…”; don’t contradict and avoid being too positive; make the most use of time, bringing points of direct interest to the customer with other points about the product.

results.title: The Selfish giant
results.creator_credit: Murray Shostak, Peter Sander, Reiner Film and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Animated interpretation of Oscar Wilde’s allegory about selfishness, sharing, and love. A beautiful garden is beset by perpetual winter after a greedy giant forbids children to play there. Then he is compelled to help a mysterious child who has entered the garden and spring comes. At his life’s end this child leads the giant to another garden.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Shostak, Peter Sander, Reiner Film and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Sea creatures
results.brief_description: An underwater look at the inhabitants of the Red Sea. These creatures appear to be from another world yet they are a very real part of the Sea’s ecosystem. Imaginative music and sound effects heighten the beautiful underwater photography. This film is a comment upon the fragile web of life. Film without narration.

results.title: The Sea
results.creator_credit: Bane Jovanovic, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The sea, and not the continents, is the dominant force on this planet. Its secrets, hidden by the vastness of the oceans, are slowly being unravelled by scientists engaged in oceanographic research. This science documentary, designed to promote a better understanding of this great resource, takes us aboard the C.S.S. Hudson, a Canadian oceanographic vessel, to explore the sea.
